abstract: Viacom, controlled by Sumner Redstone, is suing Google for $1 billion for copyright violations on its YouTube video service. But CBS, also controlled by Sumner Redstone, is making licensing deals with Google for YouTube to use some of its content. What gives?
lead_paragraph: Viacom, controlled by Sumner Redstone, is suing Google for $1 billion for copyright violations on its YouTube video service. But CBS, also controlled by Sumner Redstone, is making licensing deals with Google for YouTube to use some of its content. What gives?
